Deficiency Narrative: A psychotropic medication was administered to a child in care by an employee who has not taken or completed the required medication administration training.
Correction Narrative:
Action Plan: The staff member who administered the medication was told that they were not allowed to administer medication due to them not completing the training.
To Prevent Future Occurrence:
1.
A few days after this incident occurred, an all-staff meeting was held that covered this topic, and how to prevent it in the future. All staff were required to attend.
2.
This specific staff member will work on finishing their medication training before the date it is due.
An in-person follow up was conducted on 08/12/25. Inspector reviewed medication logs and medication packets, and interviewed the victim regarding any additional medication errors; there were no concerns.

Action Plan: Program Manager spoke with staff on 4/8/2025 and sent an email communication to all staff reiterating youth monitoring requirements, expectations, and following internal protocols as well as youth restrictions. Program Manager also conducted a meeting with all staff on 4/2/25 to discuss concerns regarding youth and maintaining consistency in internal practices specific to caregiver responsibility. Additional Counseling & Guidance was provided during in-service on 3/25/25 regarding supervision and staff accountability. All staff will receive training at the next All Staff Meeting on 5/14/25 regarding minimum standards specific to caregiver responsibility. 


To Prevent Future Occurrences: Program Manager will continue to provide minimum standards review during onboarding and monthly meetings. The program will continue to have monthly meetings for staff development and implementation of practices and protocols.

Deficiency Narrative: Caregiver does not have out-of-stated background check completed.
Correction Narrative:
The administrator reported that they have added an additional procedure with HR to ensure that all appropriate background checks are being completed prior to the caregiver/s beginning employment at the operation.  

Email received from operation: 
The out of state background checked was inadvertently missed during the pre-onboarding process for an employee. The Human Resources Director was notified. The Human Resource Department will continue to complete all required background checks and confirm clearance prior to the start of the employee. This employee is no longer with the agency as of 4/4/25. Therefore, no further action is needed for the background.
To Prevent Future Occurrences: Program Administrator will confirm with Human Resources that all background checks are completed
before the employees start date.

Deficiency Narrative: Staff member uses profane language around children in care.
Correction Narrative:
An unannounced inspection of the operation was completed.  Two staff as well as the administrator reported that they have monthly staff meetings in which they discuss appropriate behavior in front of the residents as well as steps to take when the resident's behaviors escalate.  Staff involved in the incident is no longer employed at the operation. 

Email received from operation:
Action Plan: Program Manager sent an email communication to all staff on 4/7/25 regarding. Additional Counseling & Guidance will be provided during in-service on 4/16/25. Employee, BR has been terminated due to poor job performance.
To Prevent Future Occurrences: Program Manager will continue to provide minimum standards review during onboarding and monthly meetings.

Deficiency Narrative: A Child in care was able to leave the cottage without staff knowing his whereabouts.
Correction Narrative:
Program Manager spoke with staff on 4/8/25 and sent an e-mail communication to all staff reiterating youth monitoring requirements, expectations, and following internal protocols as well as youth restrictions. Program Manager also conducted a meeting on 4/2/25 with all staff to discuss concerns regarding youth and consistency in internal practices specific to caregiver responsibility.  

Additional counseling and guidance were provided on 3/25/25 regarding supervision staff accountability. All staff will receive training at all next staff meeting on 5/14/25 regarding minimum standards specific to childcare giver responsibilities. Employee BR has been terminated due to poor job performance. 

To prevent further occurrence Program manager will continue to provide minimum standards review during onboarding and monthly meeting for staff development and implementation of practices and protocol. 

4/24/25 RCCL Inspector was provided with a copy of the corrective action plan, March 25th agenda, March 25th sign in sheet, Brandon R. termination letter, Brandon R. recommendation letter for termination, April 2 agenda, April 2 sign in sheet, and April 8 commination e0-mail to staff. All documents were uploaded into the library.

Deficiency Narrative: I was observed that the dosage was not provided on the medication logs to ensure child was administered the prescribed dosage per physician.
During a review of child files it was observed that a child in care did not a screening tool administered at the time of admission.
The child went AWOL and staff failed to conduct a debriefing with the child when they returned to the facility.
Correction Narrative:
Debriefings are always conducted with youth following AWOL and any incidents. Staff failed to document debriefing of AWOL following the youths return.

To prevent future occurrences, a debriefing protocol and form for documenting debriefings has been created and implemented. All staff were notified of the protocol and debriefing form on 1/5/24. Debriefing was also discussed with all staff at teams All Staff Meeting on 1/10/24.

Deficiency Narrative: I was observed that the dosage was not provided on the medication logs to ensure child was administered the prescribed dosage per physician.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided a screenshot of the medication log which identifies the reason for the medication. It is embedded on the line with the dosage and strength (it reads as 1xday/ 2mg/ Depression  for Sertraline).

Deficiency Narrative: During a review of the records, it was observed that a child in care did not meet with a PLSP within 24 hours of being released from the hospital after the child returned to the home.
Correction Narrative: Kelis F. returned to the home on 11/08/2023 and PLSP has been met.

Deficiency Narrative: During a review of records it was observed that a child in care had mental health diagnosis missing from their admission assessment.
Correction Narrative: Admission Assessment was modified on 1/9/2024 to meet TDFPS and YFT standards. Admission Assessment for youth reviewed (KF) was revised on 1/5/24 and 1/9/24 to include assessments of mental health/psychological, substance abuse, etc. as well as results of evaluations.

Deficiency Narrative: During a review of the records and interview of staff it was determined that the child care administrator does not maintain full time hours.
Correction Narrative: Operation has identified an LCCA however the system will not allow entering the new LCCA due to a pending data correction.

Deficiency Narrative: During a review of records it was determined that a child in care did not have a list of medications recorded in their preliminary service plan.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided an updated preliminary service plan that included the list medications. The operation will ensure all medications are listed in the preliminary plans moving forward.

Deficiency Narrative: During observation of the first aid kit, the thermometer was missing.  Corrected at inspection.
During the walkthrough of the operation, a hanging rod was observed not properly secured in the closet. This is a hazard to the children. The rod can easily be removed and can be used as a weapon.
